metadata.Title: CVE-2011-1022 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The cgre_receive_netlink_msg function in daemon/cgrulesengd.c in cgrulesengd in the Control Group Configuration Library (aka libcgroup or libcg) before 0.37.1 does not verify that netlink messages originated in the kernel, which allows local users to bypass intended resource restrictions via a crafted message.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-1022` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cgroup-bin - 0.38-1ubuntu2
cgroup-tools - 0.38-1ubuntu2
libcgroup1 - 0.38-1ubuntu2
libpam-cgroup - 0.38-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libcgroup package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.38-1ubuntu2').
